intro: Eugenia goodenovii, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 feet, with dark green, elliptical leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and lowland areas. Eugenia goodenovii plays an important ecological role in Hawaiian ecosystems and is also valued for its ornamental beauty.
